title: Enhancing Patient Care Practical Competencies: Designing Persuasive Educational Games for Scientific Attitude Transformation

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Practical competency enhancement program for medical/nursing field practitioners

learning_goals: Learners can create science education game scenarios applying persuasive message design principles (emotional appeal, evidence presentation, social proof).

Learners can design game mechanics integrating strategies for motivation (challenge tasks, reward systems), cognitive load management (simplified interfaces), and metacognition promotion (providing choices).

Learners can establish and utilize behavioral change metrics (in-game choice patterns, time investment levels) to measure attitude changes in scientific domains (e.g., environmental conservation, health behaviors).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
